repository.corpname: Digital Collections and Archives, Tufts University

origination.label: Creator
origination.corpname: Fletcher School of Law and Diplomacy

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection is organized into three series: Annual reports; Subject files; and Photographs and posters.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Some of the materials in this collection were originally part of the Tisch Library records (UA137). During the course of processing the Tisch Library records, it was decided to remove the Ginn Library materials and create a new collection. Although the Ginn and Tisch Libraries are both part of the Tufts University library system, the libraries are separate entities. This collection was processed by Abigail Cramer under the supervision of Veronica Martzahl in October and November 2010.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection contains records created by and related to the Edwin Ginn Library in the Fletcher School and includes correspondence, ledgers, minutes, posters, reports, serials, and subject files.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: The Edwin Ginn Library (1938-present) was established in 1938 as the official library for the Fletcher School of Law and Diplomacy (Graduate School of International Affairs). The library was named after donor Edwin Ginn, a former Tufts alumnus who graduated in 1862, and who made significant financial gifts to the university over the course of his life.

Prior to the establishment of the Ginn Library, the materials that started the library collection were part of Ginn's personal collection and were called the Library for World Peace Foundation. The library was originally intended to be a research collection for graduate students (Light on the Hill, 592).

As of 2011, the Edwin Ginn Library provides collections, services and technology that anticipate and meet the research and instructional needs of The Fletcher School. The Library maintains a research and study environment conducive to exploration, discovery and knowledge creation. The library's collection of primary and secondary reference and research materials has been developed with attention to the content of The Fletcher School curriculum and the research interests of students and faculty. The library contains over 120,000 volumes, including 270 current periodicals and serials. The Tufts University Libraries share over 30,000 electronic publications and databases. Ginn Library's collection covers the fields of international law and organizations; human rights; economic and political development; international energy resources and environmental matters; international security and peacekeeping; conflict negotiation; international business and finance; and the uses of the sea and outer space. The Ginn Library entrance is located on the first floor of the Mugar building.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: This collection contains some restricted material. Restrictions related to specific material are listed in the detailed contents list. The Subject files series may require review before it is available for use. Please contact DCA for further details.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Some material in this collection may be protected by copyright and other rights. Please see "Reproductions and Use" on the Digital Collections and Archives website for more information about reproductions and permission to publish. Copyright to all materials created by Tufts University employees in the course of their work is held by the Trustees of Tufts University.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains the annual reports of the Ginn Library. Most of the reports were written between 1975 and 1990. The majority of the reports were written by the Ginn Head Librarian. While most of the reports are titled "Annual Report," a few bear other titles such as "Report to the Dean" or "Report of the Reference Librarian." These reports address the overall state of the Ginn Library between 1933 and 1999.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This series is arranged by report type and then chronologically.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains subject files created by the Ginn Library. Most of these materials were created between 1979 and 1985. The subject files cover a broad array of topics, including library acquisitions, administration (including a heated debate over whether or not the Ginn Library should be independent of the Wessel/Tisch Library), information about the building and the remodeling of the building, committee meeting minutes, and circulation statistics.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This series is arranged alphabetically by subject using the original titles of folders.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Folder title should read: ICC [Intercultural Center] Gazette.

did.unittitle: Committee on the Size of the Student Body
Material Relating to Fire and Water Damage

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains one folder of promotional posters for the Ginn Library created in 2007. There are three copies of the same poster, showing the phrase "May the Source be with You" and images of the Ginn Library staff members.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This series consists of only one folder with one item (3 copies).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 3 copies of "May the Source Be With You" promotional poster; see also ARMS 13319138 for bookmarks; Moved from UA015 on 2007-12-18.

did.unittitle: Ginn Library staff with Director Jeff Kosokoff

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: From left to right in reverse chronological order that they worked in the Library: Daniel Hurwit, Lindsey Tapper, Linda Batista, Muriel Prentice, Linda Warner with Jeff Kosokoff in front. Taken at the retirement party for Karin McMaster, Fletcher Administrative Assistant.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: From left to right in reverse chronological order that they worked in the Library: Daniel Hurwit, Lindsey Tapper, Linda Batista, Muriel Prentice, and Linda Warner. Taken at the retirement party for Karin McMaster, Fletcher Administrative Assistant.
